page.title: 03The Old Courthouse
page.content: The{Malmesbury Commoners}meet several times a year in the{Old {Courthouse.}This building has had a number of uses. It was built between 1250 and 1300 as a hospital for the Knights of St. John, and for a time housed lepers. The hospital was closed down with the dissolution of the monasteries in 1535, and was taken over by the{Old Corporation.}From 1600 it was used as a school for the boys (not girls!) of Commoners. Our guide, Mr.{Bowen,}told us his grandfather was a pupil here, his grandmother went to a dame school above the Abbey doorway. We saw the pupils' desks, like A.G. 1781. The teacher sat on a high platform, and had a small stock cupboard, still carefully labelled.
